techniques.name: Validated account
techniques.description: An attacker gains access to a valid account. This can be done through credential theft, password spraying, or brute force.
techniques.mitigation: Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA), enforce strong password policies, monitor for unusual login patterns.

techniques.name: Brute force
techniques.description: An attacker tries to gain access by systematically trying multiple passwords or PINs.
techniques.mitigation: Use rate limiting, lock accounts after failed attempts, deploy WAF rules.

techniques.name: Command and scripting interpreter
techniques.description: An attacker uses a command-line interface to execute commands on a system.
techniques.mitigation: Disable unnecessary scripting, restrict execution to trusted binaries.

techniques.name: Credentials from password dump
techniques.description: An attacker extracts credentials from a local machine or memory using tools like Mimikatz.
techniques.mitigation: Enable Credential Guard, disable LM/NTLM, use LAPS for local admin passwords.

techniques.name: Phishing
techniques.description: An attacker sends deceptive emails to trick users into revealing credentials or installing malware.
techniques.mitigation: Train users on phishing awareness, implement email filtering, use DMARC/DKIM/SPF.

techniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)
techniques.description: An attacker uses WMI to execute commands remotely on Windows systems.
techniques.mitigation: Restrict WMI permissions, disable unused WMI providers, monitor WMI activity.

techniques.name: Application layer protocol
techniques.description: An attacker uses protocols like HTTP, HTTPS, or DNS to exfiltrate data or maintain persistence.
techniques.mitigation: Monitor outbound traffic, block non-essential protocols, use TLS inspection.

techniques.name: Proxy
techniques.description: An attacker uses a proxy server to hide their identity or bypass network controls.
techniques.mitigation: Block known malicious proxies, monitor for tunneling behavior, audit proxy usage.

techniques.name: Pass the hash
techniques.description: An attacker uses stolen NTLM hashes to authenticate without cracking passwords.
techniques.mitigation: Disable NTLM, enable Kerberos, use LAPS.

techniques.name: Supply chain compromise
techniques.description: An attacker compromises a software vendor to distribute malicious code.
techniques.mitigation: Verify software integrity, use SBOMs, conduct third-party audits.
